content.en:
# Kanban Board for Visual Task Management

The Kanban board provides a visual overview of all tasks in a project. Drag tasks between columns to change their status.

## What is a Kanban Board?

Kanban is a visual method for task management:

**Advantages:**
- âœ… Quick overview of all tasks
- âœ… See immediately where tasks are "stuck"
- âœ… Drag & drop instead of clicking
- âœ… Ideal for stand-ups and team meetings
- âœ… Focus on workflow progress

**Disadvantages:**
- âŒ Less detail visible than in list view
- âŒ Difficult with very many tasks (> 50)
- âŒ No sorting/filtering like in table

> **Recommendation:** Use Kanban for daily work, list view for planning and reports.

[Screenshot: Kanban board]

## Open Kanban View

1. Open your project
2. Click on tab **"Tasks"**
3. Click on **Kanban icon** (top right in toolbar)

The board appears with columns for each status.

[Screenshot: View toggle]

## Board Structure

### The 3 Main Columns

**1. Pending (Open)**
- Tasks not yet started
- Status: "Pending"
- Color: Gray

**2. In Progress (In Work)**
- Tasks currently being worked on
- Status: "In Progress"
- Color: Blue

**3. Completed (Done)**
- Finished tasks
- Status: "Completed"
- Color: Green

### Additional Columns (optional)

**Blocked**
- Tasks waiting for something
- Only visible when blocked tasks exist
- Color: Red

**Cancelled**
- Tasks no longer needed
- Automatically hidden (can be shown via filter)
- Color: Dark gray

### Column Header

Each column header shows:
- **Column name** (e.g., "In Progress")
- **Task count** (e.g., "5 Tasks")
- **Aggregated progress** (average of all tasks in column)

[Screenshot: Column header]

## Understanding Task Cards

Each task is displayed as a card:

### Card Layout

**Top:**
- **Title** (bold)
- **Priority icon** (ğŸ”´ Urgent, ğŸŸ¡ High, ğŸŸ¢ Medium, âšª Low)

**Middle:**
- **Progress bar** (0-100%)
- **Checklist status** (e.g., "3/5 done")

**Bottom:**
- **Avatar** of assigned person
- **Deadline badge** (date, color-coded)
- **Tag badges** (if present)

### Color Coding

**Deadline Badge:**
- ğŸŸ¢ Green: > 7 days left
- ğŸŸ¡ Yellow: 3-7 days left
- ğŸ”´ Red: < 3 days OR overdue

**Card Background:**
- White: Normal
- Light red: Overdue
- Light gray: Completed (grayed out)

[Screenshot: Task card]

## Using Drag & Drop

### Drag Task Between Columns

1. **Click and hold** on task card
2. **Drag** to desired column
3. **Release** when column is highlighted green

**Automatically:**
- Status changes to match column
- For "Completed": Progress â†’ 100%
- Timestamp is updated
- Team members are notified

### Sort Within Column

1. Drag task **within** same column
2. Position changes
3. Order is saved

**Benefit:**
- Make prioritization visible
- Most important tasks to top
- Manual sorting instead of automatic

### Multi-Select (Coming Soon)

Drag multiple tasks at once:
1. Hold **Ctrl/Cmd**
2. Click on multiple cards
3. Drag all together

## Task Actions on Cards

### Quick Actions (Hover)

When you hover over a card, icons appear:

**âœï¸ Edit**
- Opens task detail panel
- Quick editing

**âœ“ Complete**
- Marks task as done
- Automatically moves to "Completed" column

**â‹® More**
- Dropdown with additional actions:
  - Duplicate task
  - Delete task
  - Change priority
  - Edit tags

[Screenshot: Card hover with icons]

### Open Task Details

**Click on Card:**
- Detail panel opens on right
- Shows all information
- Inline editing possible
- Close via X or Esc

**Double-click on Card:**
- Fullscreen editor opens
- More space for description/checklist
- Ideal for complex tasks

## Use Board Filters

### Toolbar Filters

**My Tasks vs. All Tasks:**
- Toggle between personal view and team view
- Default: "My Tasks" (only assigned to you)

**Priority Filter:**
- Checkbox for Low / Medium / High / Urgent
- Multiple selection possible
- Only selected priorities shown

**Deadline Filter:**
- "Overdue"
- "This Week"
- "Next Week"
- "No Deadline"

**Team Member Filter:**
- Filter by assigned person
- Ideal for focusing on individual team members
- Show tasks without assignment

[Screenshot: Filter toolbar]

## Board Limits (WIP Limits)

### Set Work-in-Progress Limits (Coming Soon)

**Concept:**
- Limit number of tasks per column
- Prevents overload
- Promotes focus

**Example:**
- Pending: Unlimited
- In Progress: Max. 5 tasks
- Blocked: Max. 2 tasks
- Completed: Unlimited

**Warning when limit reached:**
- Column turns orange
- Drag & drop is blocked
- Must complete tasks first

## Keyboard Shortcuts

**Navigation:**
- **â†â†’**: Switch between columns
- **â†‘â†“**: Switch between cards in column
- **Enter**: Open selected card
- **Space**: Quick-complete (check card)

**Actions:**
- **E**: Edit task
- **D**: Duplicate task
- **Del**: Delete task (confirmation needed)
- **C**: Mark task as completed
- **B**: Block task

**View:**
- **L**: Switch to list view
- **K**: Switch to Kanban view
- **F**: Open filter panel

## Board vs. List - When to Use What?

### Use Kanban Board for:

âœ… **Daily Stand-ups**
- Quick overview of where everyone is
- See blockages immediately

âœ… **Workflow Focus**
- Concentrate on status transitions
- Move tasks forward

âœ… **Team Collaboration**
- Shared board in meeting
- Live updates visible

âœ… **Sprint Planning (Agile)**
- Plan work for sprint
- Move tasks to "In Progress"

### Use List View for:

âœ… **Detail Work**
- All fields at a glance
- Sort by deadline, priority, assignee

âœ… **Planning & Reports**
- Overview of all tasks
- Export to Excel/CSV

âœ… **Many Tasks (> 50)**
- Pagination possible
- Better performance

âœ… **Bulk Actions**
- Edit multiple tasks simultaneously
- Filter + Select + Action

## Mobile Kanban (Touch Devices)

### Touch Optimization

**Drag & Drop:**
- **Long-press** on card (1 second)
- Card lifts up (shadow)
- Drag to desired column
- Release to drop

**Swipe Gestures:**
- **Swipe right**: Move task right (e.g., Pending â†’ In Progress)
- **Swipe left**: Move task left (e.g., In Progress â†’ Pending)
- **Double-tap**: Open task details

**Compact View:**
- Smaller cards on mobile
- Only title + avatar + deadline visible
- Details via tap

## Tips for Efficient Board Management

### 1. Keep "In Progress" Clean

Rule: **Max. 3-5 tasks per person simultaneously**

Why?
- Context switching is expensive
- Focus on finishing instead of starting
- "Done" is better than "90% finished"

### 2. Review Blocked Tasks Daily

**Morning Routine:**
- Check "Blocked" column
- Actively resolve blockers
- Move back to "In Progress" when possible

### 3. Archive Completed Regularly

**Weekly:**
- Archive old completed tasks (> 2 weeks)
- Board stays clear
- Performance improves

### 4. Use Colored Tags

**Example Tag System:**
- ğŸ”´ "Urgent": Do immediately
- ğŸŸ¡ "Blocked": Needs attention
- ğŸ”µ "Review": Ready for review
- ğŸŸ¢ "Quick-Win": < 1 hour

### 5. Share Board in Meetings

**Stand-up Format:**
1. Screen share the board
2. Each explains their cards in "In Progress"
3. Discuss blockers together
4. Move new tasks to "Pending"

## Frequently Asked Questions

**Can I create custom columns?**

Currently: No, columns are fixed (Pending, In Progress, Blocked, Completed).

Coming Soon: Custom columns for individual workflows.

**How do I sort tasks within a column?**

1. Drag cards manually up/down
2. Order is saved

OR:
1. Click on column header
2. Choose sorting:
   - Manual (Drag & Drop)
   - By priority
   - By deadline
   - By assignee

**Do completed tasks disappear automatically?**

No, they remain visible in "Completed" column (grayed out).

Hide via:
- Filter "Hide completed tasks"
- OR: Archive old tasks (bulk action)

**Can I export the board?**

Yes:
1. Click **â‹®** â†’ **"Export board"**
2. Choose format:
   - Screenshot (PNG)
   - PDF (for meetings)
   - CSV (data)

**Are there board templates?**

Coming Soon: Predefined boards for typical workflows:
- Product Launch Board
- Event PR Board
- Crisis PR Board

## Next Steps

- [Understand tasks](/support/en/projekte/tasks-verstehen)
- [Create task](/support/en/projekte/task-erstellen)
- [Change task status](/support/en/projekte/task-status)
- [Use task filters](/support/en/projekte/tasks-verstehen)
